intro: Zeuxine procumbens, commonly known as the prostrate zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its delicate, herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically features small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Zeuxine procumbens thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
